etymology.description: 初(初) (chū, 'initial') depiction unclear -> later interpretations consider abbreviated 壴(壴) (zhù, 'drum') + 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth') = drum with open mouth -> 'announce, tell'
etymology.interpretation: The character 告(告) (gào, 'inform; announce; tell') likely evolved from a depiction related to announcing or informing others using a combination of sound (drum) and speech (mouth). The interpretation of 告(告) as a drum and mouth aligns with its meaning of announcing or speaking out loud.

examples.chinese: 老师告学生(老師告學生)，考试规则已更新(考試規則已更新)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī gào xuéshēng, kǎoshì guīzé yǐ gēngxīn.
examples.english: The teacher informed the students that the exam rules have been updated.

examples.chinese: 父亲告我(父親告我)，晚上早點回家(晚上早點回家)。
examples.pinyin: Fùqīn gào wǒ, wǎnshàng zǎodiǎn huí jiā.
examples.english: My father informed me to come home early tonight.
